headline: Cavuto: Remembering 'Mickie' Siebert
subHeadline: She never wanted to be a trailblazer.

utterances.speaker: MICKIE SIEBERT
utterances.sentences: It's your spirit that counts and your ability and also your energy level. I started at 6 o'clock this morning and I'll go right through dinner. And then I have a trainer at 6 o'clock tomorrow morning, but then I have a masseuse that comes in at 7.   May 18, 1999

utterances.speaker: SIEBERT
utterances.sentences: They want to use the internet and we made it easy to use.

utterances.speaker: NEIL CAVUTO
utterances.sentences: Do you find it at all ironic, and you've told me yourself, you've been around the block a few times, you're older than a lot of these whiz kids, and yet ironically at a business they supposedly created and dominate, here it takes the first woman on Wall Street to show them how it's done?

utterances.speaker: SIEBERT
utterances.sentences: I had to be tutored to learn how to do it.

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.sentences: I just find that fascinating you know.

utterances.speaker: SIEBERT
utterances.sentences: Well I realized that technology was either going to be our friend or enemy. I realized that three, four years ago. And I decided to make it our friend. September 19, 2008

utterances.speaker: SIEBERT
utterances.sentences: He called me back, it was John McGillicuddy who ran Manufacturers Hanover. He called me back and said, Mickie you have the authority to give me a temporary branch; go out and buy a card table and four chairs. So when these people who were stepping up to the teller and taking their money out in cash, we had two people from that Manufacturers Hanover writing out the process--

utterances.speaker: CAVUTO
utterances.sentences: Well you've calmed people down Mickie-- May 18, 1999

utterances.speaker: SIEBERT
utterances.sentences: Why not? I've been first many times, but this is a big one!  It seems silly now, but there was a time when Mickie Siebert was first hunting for a job on Wall Street, that she'd have her resume distributed under the name M.F. Siebert.   "I'd get the job interview, but boy, when they saw me show up in their office for the interview!" She laughed. She won.  Mickie Siebert. Dead. At age 84.

He called me back and said, Mickie you have the authority to give me a temporary branch; go out and buy a card table and four chairs. So when these people who were stepping up to the teller and taking their money out in cash, we had two people from that Manufacturers Hanover writing out the process--

It seems silly now, but there was a time when Mickie Siebert was first hunting for a job on Wall Street, that she'd have her resume distributed under the name M.F. Siebert. "I'd get the job interview, but boy, when they saw me show up in their office for the interview!" She laughed. She won. Mickie Siebert. Dead. At age 84.
